title: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB:
When I open an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository, and mark the file as dirty by adding a space character at the end of the first line, the following behavior is observed:

1) Clicking on the close box in the editor tab closes the file without saving changes and prompts a dialog asking if I want to save the changes. Clicking 'no' on the dialog closes the file.
2) Double-clicking on the file in the navigator reopens the file without saving changes.

Expected Behavior:
After marking the file as dirty, performing the steps mentioned above (closing and reopening the file) should take around 8 seconds.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Open an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository.
2) Add a space character at the end of the first line to mark the file as dirty.
3) Click on the close box in the editor tab and choose 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
4) Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.

Additionally, repeating steps 1 and 2 and then selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor should take approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original text.
EB: After marking the file as dirty, the process of closing and reopening the file should take approximately 8 seconds. The 'Revert' operation from the pop-up menu in the editor should take approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original text.
SR:
1) Open the editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository.
2) Add a space character at the end of the first line to mark the file as dirty.
3) Click on the close box in the editor tab and select 'no' when prompted to save changes.
4) Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.

To reproduce the slower 'Revert' behavior:
1) Repeat steps 1 and 2.
2) Right-click anywhere in the editor and select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu.
